author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court on Thursday passed an interim stay against the order of a single judge directing the State government to provide entertainment tax exemption to Tamil movie ‘ Gethu ’, starring Udhayanidhi Stalin.

A Division Bench of Justices V. Ramasubramanian and N. Kirubakaran passed the order on an appeal moved by the Principal Secretary of Tamil Nadu Commercial Taxes Department assailing the order of a single judge dated February 5.

Alleging that the State government had “mechanically” accepted the recommendations of the Viewing Committee which decided that the film title Gethu is not a Tamil word and thereby denied entertainment tax exemption to the film, the producer, Red Gaint Movies, approached the High Court sought quashing of the order. Observing that when the title of the film finds a place in Tamil dictionaries and mentioning of the title in English as ‘Gethu’ and not ‘Kethu’ has no relevance for the grant of exemption of entertainment tax, a single judge of the court granted it exemption from the date of release.

Assailing the order, the State government preferred an appeal. It contended that the order of the single judge was erroneous, contrary to law, weight of evidence and probabilities of the case and sought the court to set aside the order.

State government argued that

the order of

the single judge

is erroneous
title: Order granting tax waiver for Gethu stayed
